main.speaker: Mr. Jefferson
main.text: Oh, that is not very good. At our company, we want everyone to be able to present their ideas and bounce off of each others creativity.
To be fair, the superiors usually had the right ideas and there was not much wrong with them.

main.speaker: Mr. Jefferson
main.text: But what if you or your co-workers had a brilliant idea?
Yeah, that is true. That would just be a wasted idea then.

main.speaker: Mr. Jefferson
main.text: Yes, and that is what we want to try to avoid since we believe the best ideas come from collaborating and merging ideas.
